TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void DataObjectPastingEventHandler(object sender, DataObjectPastingEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed DataObjectPastingEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub DataObjectPastingEventHandler(sender As Object, e As DataObjectPastingEventArgs)
public delegate void DataObjectPastingEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, DataObjectPastingEventArgs ^ e);
type DataObjectPastingEventHandler = delegate of obj * DataObjectPastingEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: The object where the event handler is attached.
Docs.summary: Represents a method that will handle the attached event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Pasting> attached event occurs when a paste operation has selected a data format to paste, but before the data is actually pasted.
Actions typically performed by a <xref:System.Windows.DataObject.Pasting> attached event handler include:
- Change the selected paste format by setting new value for the <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectPastingEventArgs.FormatToApply%2A> property.
- Apply a custom data format to the paste selection.
- Create a new <xref:System.Windows.DataObject>, and assign it to the <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectPastingEventArgs.DataObject%2A> property of `e`. A read-only copy of the original data object is stored in <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectPastingEventArgs.SourceDataObject%2A>.
- Cancel the paste operation by calling <xref:System.Windows.DataObjectEventArgs.CancelCommand%2A>.
> [!IMPORTANT] > If the paste format is changed, the handler method is responsible for ensuring that a newly selected paste format is consumable by the paste target.
